channel.title: How do i make my browser search a word automatically?
channel.description:
Well i want people to type in my search bar and after they type it in a word that they cant see always stays in front of it
e.g. they type in "Bubble Gum" and without them knowning it actually searches "Bubble Gum (whatever i want to put here)"[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 04, 2009, 04:20:30 am[/size][hr]btw ive already got my google search bar i just need to figure out how to make it do that ^

item.title: How do i make my browser search a word automatically?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Instead of PHP I really think javascript was the way to go here, of course you could fall back to use PHP if javascript is not available.

item.source: How do i make my browser search a word automatically?

item.title: How do i make my browser search a word automatically?
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:3, topic:317498”][quote author=imjohn10 link=topic=414018.msg3048383#msg3048383 date=1259943038]

[code]<?php
if ( !empty($_POST[‘search’]) ) {
$suffix = ‘something’;
header('Location: http://www.google.com/search?q=’.$_POST[‘search’].’ ’ . $suffix);
}
?>

[/code]

Do you mean something like this?
[/quote]
Ive already got my search bar heres my code

<form method="get" action="http://www.google.com/search">

<div style="border:1px solid black;padding:4px;width:20em;">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr><td>
<input type="text"   name="q" size="25"
 maxlength="255" value="" />
<input type="submit" value="Google Search" /></td></tr>
<tr><td align="center" style="font-size:75%"><br />
</td></tr></table>
</div>

But i want it so when someone searches Bubble and everytime someone types something in just say i want it to say Gum after it everytime someone types something in.[/quote]What he posted is exactly what u want, learn php

Read full topic

item.title: How do i make my browser search a word automatically?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“imjohn10, post:2, topic:317498”][code]<?php
if ( !empty($_POST[‘search’]) ) {
$suffix = ‘something’;
header('Location: http://www.google.com/search?q=’.$_POST[‘search’].’ ’ . $suffix);
}
?>

[/code]

Do you mean something like this?[/quote]
Ive already got my search bar heres my code

<form method="get" action="http://www.google.com/search">

<div style="border:1px solid black;padding:4px;width:20em;">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr><td>
<input type="text"   name="q" size="25"
 maxlength="255" value="" />
<input type="submit" value="Google Search" /></td></tr>
<tr><td align="center" style="font-size:75%"><br />
</td></tr></table>
</div>

But i want it so when someone searches Bubble and everytime someone types something in just say i want it to say Gum after it everytime someone types something in.
